Job title: Senior Software Engineer - Banking
Description:
The banking team within Spendesk oversees everything thing related to money. From generating virtual cards, to making a wire transfer, or maintaining balance for customer accounts. This critical part of the software requires secure and reliable solutions. Your work is to develop and maintain the API that offers banking services within Spendesk, and the back office that allows internal auditors to operate the banking platform.
We expect engineers to be able to work on every part of the feature, specs, technical design, development, testing, documentation, and maintenance. Money doesn't allow approximation; in the banking squad, we don't compromise over quality.
Finally, your job is not only about writing code, we are looking for great team players. As money is at the heart of our system, you’ll get to work closely with anyone across the company and every decision you’ll make may have a huge impact.
Our stack:
Typescript
Node.js for our backend and banking applications
React/Redux on the frontend of the Backoffice.
PostgreSQL for data storage, Redis and SQS for jobs and queues
Terraform to define our infrastructure
AWS to run all of this
Github actions for CI.
What we're looking for:
Numerous years’ experience in back-end development with respect to state-of-the-art practices
Strong experience in designing distributed and secure systems
Modern JavaScript/ES6 libraries
Experience with NodeJS on large scale backend applications
Good knowledge of micro-services architectures
Experience designing, building and maintaining APIs
A product focussed mindset
Comfortable with DevOps aspects
Autonomy, fast-learning and proactiveness
Good knowledge on testing best practices
As we are an international team, please submit your application and CV in English.


About Spendesk
Spendesk is the 7-in-1 spending solution built for finance teams to make faster, smarter spending decisions. Founded in 2016, Spendesk is now one of the fastest-growing fintechs in Europe, with over 4,000 customers and an international team of 500+ employees based in Paris, Berlin, London, Hamburg, and remote. We’ve raised over €260M from leading investors, and been named a French tech unicorn. And we’re not stopping there!

About our people & culture
We believe that people do their best work when they’re given the freedom to thrive and grow. That’s why liberation is at the core of everything we do. We empower Spendeskers to take ownership of their work, to navigate ambiguity, and seize every opportunity. Spendeskers come from all over the world (35+ countries and counting!) but we have plenty in common: we're bold, ever-curious, committed to kindness, and tackle every challenge with a positive mindset.

About our benefits
Our culture is built on trust, empowerment, and growth — with benefits to match!

Fully covered Oyster card for traveling to and from our new office (up to £250 monthly depending on location)
-£45 monthly wellness allowance, accruable, to be used on whatever wellness means to you - through the Ben platform
Access to Moka.care for emotional and mental health wellbeing
Pension scheme (on salary sacrifice): 5% employee / 5% employer (by Aviva)
28 days of holidays
Latest Apple Mac equipment
Company virtual events
Visit our other offices: Paris, Berlin & Hamburg
Great office snacks to fuel your day
A positive team to work with daily!
Vitality private health insurance (for you and your family/partner)
Bupa private dental care

Diversity & Inclusion
At Spendesk, we're committed to fostering an environment where all differences are encouraged, supported and celebrated. We're building our culture for everyone, with everyone. Our goal is to attract and build a diverse, equal and inclusive team, where everyone feels welcome and we truly embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

What you can expect from the hiring process:

1. A video call with one of our Talent Acquisition Partners to fully understand your career aspirations and answer any questions you have
2. A series of video calls with members of the team to align on what they will expect from you, and assess your technical skills and job fit
3. A final video call with the Hiring Manager, Head-Of or CEO depending on the seniority level to review any remaining questions

Job title: Commercial Valuation Surveyor / Senior Surveyor
Description:
Sector: General Practice Surveyor
Job Type: Permanent
Salary: £45,000 - £55,000 Plus Car Allowance & Benefits
Town/City: London
Region: London
Country: United Kingdom
Reference: AK18968

The Client
Our client is a Leading Property Consultancy with exciting, sustainable growth plans over the next few years looking for amazing people who want to grow along with them. They are a business that values our people that has launched exciting people initiatives to better people's experience, engaging with their people to listen to their needs and wants.
They are proud of their flexible approach to work and offer a hybrid set up where your home location in or around the outer London area should not be a barrier to undertaking this role – they are flexible on where you work, noting that you need to spend time in the London office, and to be able to service clients.
This is a company with a difference, working on a solid foundation of mutual trust, we are commercially focussed, and business orientated. Employing over 230 staff in the UK with a fast-growing presence, serving a wide range of Clients, they have established a strong track record and reputation as the ‘Partner with a purpose’ to help each Client get the most out of their property.
Through a strong network of offices in the UK, they offer a wide range of property services including consultancy, management, investment and commercial agency, residential sales & lettings.
The Role
A great opportunity exists for an experienced Commercial Valuation Surveyor or Senior Surveyor, looking for a position with the potential to progress, based in new West End offices.
The role will predominantly involve providing advice over a wide variety of investment property classes, acting for a range of clients from institutional pension funds, investment fund managers, high net worth individuals and family estates. There will also be the opportunity to undertake loan security valuations, purchase advisory, tax and other ad hoc valuations.
The company has a strong reputation for consultancy and advisory work, and an impressive client list, who have recently provided excellent independent feedback on their service, with metrics well above industry benchmarks. It’s a great place to work, with a strong reputation for quality service and remains an independent partnership.
Key Deliverables
Directly involved with the growth of the commercial valuation business
Ability to lead on the valuation of portfolios reporting directly to clients
High quality presentation skills, with the ability to present information accurately and succinctly both orally and in reports
Ability to reach firm and justifiable conclusions on values for work undertaken by yourself and other members of the team
Ability to work independently with minimal peer review
Ability to deal with several instructions at the same time efficiently and effectively
Deliver fee income commensurate with role.
Requirements
Member of the RICS (MRICS/FRICS)
RICS Registered Valuer
Driving licence
Either just qualified or up to 3 years PQE
Essential Experience
Demonstrable depth of experience in undertaking commercial valuation work across the UK
Proven record in valuation of a wide range of commercial property in several sectors
Experience of direct reporting to clients with good client satisfaction results
Good working knowledge of principal valuation software packages, including Argus Enterprise, Argus Developer and Capitalisation, and KEL Sigma & Developer
Experience of enhancing business performance through use of technology (PropTech), smart working processes, and developing new business initiatives that have led to growth and profitability
Established personal market profile with a range of clients, business, and professional network
Track record of being an active new business generator
Fully conversant with up-to-date RICS Valuation - Professional Standards and financial reporting standards for UK GAAP and IFRS for valuations
Other
Full Driving licence
Sociable
Team player
Benefits
Holidays: 25 – increase in line with length of service to a maximum of 30 days
Enhanced Auto Enrolment Pension Scheme
Life Assurance
Interest Free Season Ticket Loans
Cycle to work scheme
Flu and Eye Care Vouchers
Employee Assistance Programme
Plus, Flexible benefits as below
Policy that allows you to pick and choose additional benefits including purchasing 5 days additional holiday
Discounted Gym membership
Dental Insurance
Travel Insurance
My client offers real scope for career development for a dedicated, professional and enthusiastic individual with a strong work ethic who wants to join one of the market leaders.
If you wish to apply for this position, please email your CV to andrew@kingsleyrecruitment.co.uk or call Andrew Kingsley on 07879 413 765 for further information.

Job title: Senior Operational Software Engineer - Risk Technology
Description:
Operational Software Engineers are responsible for building out, automating, and supporting our critical systems. In this role, you will combine problem solving skills with software and systems engineering to take a proactive approach in building fault-tolerant systems, improving observability/monitoring/alerting capabilities, automating tasks and build tools.
This role, based in London, will be part of the global Risk Technology team, responsible for running the platform that calculates Market Risk, Credit Risk and Margin Calcs for the entire bank. You will have the opportunity to impact the Commodities and Global Markets division within Macquarie front to back, building relationships with a motivated and agile global technology community. You will deliver high quality, low touch, scalable solutions across a mix of technologies and deployment stacks, including cloud and Kubernetes.
You will be offered the opportunity to learn from peers, be encouraged to collaborate and to be bold. You will be an active member of the team, contributing to ideas and peer reviews, mentoring others and being accountable for your solutions end to end.
About You:
A passion for technology, automation and continuous innovation.
Strong analytical, problem solving and debugging skills.
A learning mindset, and the curiosity to dive under the covers.
Effective interpersonal skills and the ability to mentor, coach, team building.
Strong influencing and negotiation skills.
Be proactive in identifying gaps, prioritizing and making suggestions.
Your Experience:
3+ years of experience in Unix/Linux and Bash
3+ Software development experience using Python, Java, C++ or similar
Experience with Git, CI/CD tooling (eg Jenkins)
Hands on experience with Cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, GCP, etc.)
Knowledge of good software design and application architectural practices.
Ability to define and measure non-functional requirements, such as reliability, availability, security, and performance.
Other Valuable Experience:
Docker, Kubernetes, Helm
Financial Services / capital markets experience or interest
Observability and monitoring/alerting – Prometheus, Splunk, Jaeger
Build Tooling – Bazel, Gradle, etc
If this role sounds like the right opportunity to further your career, please apply via the link.
About Commodities and Global Markets
Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable workplace enables us to embrace that diversity to deliver more innovative and sustainable solutions for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. At Macquarie, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If you're inspired to deliver on our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’, we want you on our team. If you need adjustments made to the recruitment process, please reach out to your recruiter.
As an inclusive employer, Macquarie does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (including colour and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief.

Joining Macquarie means you’ll be able to work in a way that suits you best. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways. Talk to us about what working arrangements would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 18,000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Job title: Senior Java Engineer – FinTech backed by Investment Bank
Description:
Salt are recruiting for Senior Java Engineers for a high growth FinTech startup in London – they were spun out of a major American investment bank 2 years ago and in that time they’ve raised $73M and grown to circa 200 employees – and they are just getting started!
As a Senior Java Engineer, you will be joining a technology team currently 46 people strong, working across 3 separate product offerings that supply into 29 markets as their global footprint quickly expands.

Using the latest technology stacks to deliver cutting edge solutions using the lastes version of Java, Go, C-based languages or Python. If you love to lead, solve challenging problems, and operate in a fast-paced environment, this role is for you.
Design, build, and own systems and capabilities needed for cloud financial management across globally distributed businesses and teams

CLOUD PLATFORM ENGINEER – SOFTWARE ENGINEER
SALARY [£58,000 - £65,000]
HYBRID WORKING [LONDON] 2-3 DAYS A WEEK
**SPONSORSHIP AVAILABLE**
My client is a market leading bank, well established for many years who uses state of the art technology.
You’ll be working as part of the Market Valuation and Risk Management (MVRM) Technology area inside Risk, Finance, and Treasury. MVRM systems enable the bank’s risk functions and trading businesses to calculate, generate, analyse, and report on the bank’s significant risk and capital metrics to our regulators.
The clients strategic platform - RiskFinder - is a complete solution for Risk and Capital Metric Management, consisting of a scalable full-revaluation calculation engine with 50k cores, a multi-petabyte-scale Big Data analytics platform, and low-latency in-memory distributed grid reporting technologies. The platform is used by multiple domains/clients, and demand is forecasted to grow significantly in the next five years.
The clients technology stack includes Java, C, C++, PostGres, OracleDB, Lua, Python, Scala, and Spark, plus other off-the-shelf products integrated into one platform.
Your key responsibilities
Collaborating with Product Managers, user experience designers and functional analysts to understand the new system, user-facing desktop, and mobile features
Building the required features as a member of an agile feature team
Cooperating with our quality assurance team to ensure the quality of all changes to the platform
Participating in iteration planning and sprint review ceremonies and engaging with your feature team in the SAFe Program Increment process
Helping maintain code quality via code reviews
Your skills and experience
Educated to bachelor’s degree level (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics preferred) or equivalent qualification/work experience
Experience of a systems language (C, C++, Java, C# etc.)
Knowledge of SQL and Python and in-depth knowledge of Operating Systems, shell languages, git, Software Development Lifecycle tooling
Strong hands-on delivery track record, good exposure to computational concepts and excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal
Cloud (mainly Google) experience is advantageous

Experience leading cloud transformations in enterprise financial services organizations.
Experience in creating an end-to-end design across various functional domains.
Experience in managing C-level relationships and stakeholder landscape.
Experience in influencing and driving design choices.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience in creating technology strategy, capability roadmaps, and implementation approaches for large migration programs.
Experience in creating end-to-end solution architecture for various financial services workloads and considering the operational needs of a large organization.
Experience in engaging product organization and influencing others to work on product features to drive the overall product strategy and roadmap.
Experience working with cross-functional teams.
About the job
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Drive cloud design and technical delivery across infrastructure, networking, operations, and application migrations by providing technical direction and design leadership.
Engage with the C-level leaders and act as a technical advisor to build confidence and organize overall IT strategy aligned to the broader business needs.
Drive tactical and strategic decision-making for a technology transformation journey. Provide credible advice by leveraging cross-functional technical and functional domains.
Drive industry centric accelerators, assets, and point-of-view to create broader impact across the industry in a specific domain or a technology area.
Ensure predictable technical outcomes for workload migrations to Google Cloud Platform considering the technical and delivery constraints.

Job title: Senior Cloud Architect – (GCP & Financial Services)
Description:
Since 1993, EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM) has leveraged its advanced software engineering heritage to become the foremost global digital transformation services provider – leading the industry in digital and physical product development and digital platform engineering services. Through its innovative strategy; integrated advisory, consulting, and design capabilities; and unique 'Engineering DNA,' EPAM's globally deployed hybrid teams help make the future real for clients and communities around the world by powering better enterprise, education and health platforms that connect people, optimize experiences, and improve people's lives. In 2021, EPAM was added to the S&P 500 and included among the list of Forbes Global 2000 companies.
Selected by Newsweek as a 2021 and 2022 Most Loved Workplace, EPAM's global multi-disciplinary teams serve customers in more than 50 countries across six continents. As a recognized leader, EPAM is listed among the top 15 companies in Information Technology Services on the Fortune 1000 and ranked four times as the top IT services company on Fortune's 100 Fastest Growing Companies list. EPAM is also listed among Ad Age's top 25 World's Largest Agency Companies for three consecutive years, and Consulting Magazine named EPAM Continuum a top 20 Fastest Growing Firm.
Learn more at www.epam.com and follow EPAM on Twitter and LinkedIn.
DESCRIPTION



Are you an industry visionary and technologist at heart with a passion for designing complex hybrid cloud solutions? Are you a leader with multi cloud knowledge and strong technical background in Architecture design and GCP? Do you have great soft skills, strong stakeholder management and are you able to guide and advise the business and IT teams on the technical and organisational challenges of enterprise cloud transformation?

Then you have an opportunity to joins us as a Senior Cloud Architect, be part of a global EPAM GCP Cloud team and work with one of our biggest EPAM customers.

Bringing your expertise in containerization, architecture design and management skills, you will be leading the Hybrid Cloud Platform team, to build and implement containers strategies using Anthos for Public Clouds and on-prem environments. You will be working closely with experts from connected practices to ensure that your architecture design incorporates smoothly into the bigger, holistically designed solution whilst becoming a Subject Matter Expert in this field and playing an important role in the relationship with our customer.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with business in identifying solution requirements and key case-studies/scenarios for the future solution
Enable multi cloud journey, analyse TCO and create a business case, make the Cloud dream become reality
Design and prototype cloud infrastructure, create infrastructure and security architecture document covering deep technical aspects of the implementation
Create a unified strategy for cloud transformation governance, automation, security, implementation, and operations
Analyse existing application and IT services portfolios, develop assets’ migration, transformation and automation roadmap
Lead implementation of the solution from establishing project requirements and goals to solution "go-live"
Oversee the cloud system engineering efforts and provide technical help as needed
Design and develop next-generation hybrid-cloud and multi cloud solutions, supervising their implementation, ensuring that the industry best practices are followed
Work in a tight cooperation with GCP architecture and delivery team to ensure a successful implementation and transparent delivery of the projects
Robust and consistent Cloud Strategy design aligned with business objectives
Provide guidelines for infrastructure migration approaches and techniques including numerous applications migrations into the cloud and implementation of hybrid cloud solutions within regulated enterprise environments
Day-to-day lead the client through the technical and organizational challenges of Cloud transformation
Maintain a strong understanding of industry trends and best practices and create thought leadership on GCP solutions

REQUIREMENTS
Hands-on multi cloud or GCP delivery experience in a Lead/Senior Architect position
Google Cloud Platform Expertise in Financial Services Industry
Technical expertise with Anthos Service Mesh
Avid technologist, with strong technical background and deep expertise in modern cloud architecture
A strong history of successful implementation of complex multi cloud or GCP solutions
Experience architecting, designing, migrating workloads to the public cloud
Multi-tier distributed architecture experience within IT consulting, IT operations, application development or support which includes migrating, architecting, operating on premises and cloud-based solutions, or experience transforming legacy IT solutions, and working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
A strong management and leadership skillset, experienced managing medium to large sized teams including budgeting, staffing, escalations, development
Experience developing proper product approach for platforms and implement container strategies using Anthos (or other container platforms) for public cloud and on prem environments
Ability to suggest competitive and innovative technical decisions, get client buy-in and deliver on commitments
In-depth understanding and hands on experience with DevOps techniques and processes related to cloud solutions
Extensive experience and understanding of Cloud FinOps
Broad knowledge of troubleshooting approaches and driving-to-resolution technical integration issues across various platforms
Experience in architecting and running consumer-facing applications in a hybrid, multi-cloud environment
Strong written, verbal communication skills with ability to present technical ideas in business-friendly language
Analytical and problem-solving abilities

WE OFFER
We offer a range of benefits including
A competitive group pension plan, life assurance and income protection
Private medical insurance, private dental care and critical illness cover
Cycle scheme Tech scheme and season ticket loan
Employee assistance program
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) (subject to certain eligibility requirements)
Various perks such as Gym discount, Friday lunch, on-site massage and regular social events
Some of these benefits may be available only after you have passed your probationary period

Job title: Senior Software Engineer - Banking
Description:
The banking team within Spendesk oversees everything thing related to money. From generating virtual cards, to making a wire transfer, or maintaining balance for customer accounts. This critical part of the software requires secure and reliable solutions. Your work is to develop and maintain the API that offers banking services within Spendesk, and the back office that allows internal auditors to operate the banking platform.
We expect engineers to be able to work on every part of the feature, specs, technical design, development, testing, documentation, and maintenance. Money doesn't allow approximation; in the banking squad, we don't compromise over quality.
Finally, your job is not only about writing code, we are looking for great team players. As money is at the heart of our system, you’ll get to work closely with anyone across the company and every decision you’ll make may have a huge impact.
Our stack:
Typescript
Node.js for our backend and banking applications
React/Redux on the frontend of the Backoffice.
PostgreSQL for data storage, Redis and SQS for jobs and queues
Terraform to define our infrastructure
AWS to run all of this
Github actions for CI.
What we're looking for:
Numerous years’ experience in back-end development with respect to state-of-the-art practices
Strong experience in designing distributed and secure systems
Modern JavaScript/ES6 libraries
Experience with NodeJS on large scale backend applications
Good knowledge of micro-services architectures
Experience designing, building and maintaining APIs
A product focussed mindset
Comfortable with DevOps aspects
Autonomy, fast-learning and proactiveness
Good knowledge on testing best practices
As we are an international team, please submit your application and CV in English.


About Spendesk
Spendesk is the 7-in-1 spending solution built for finance teams to make faster, smarter spending decisions. Founded in 2016, Spendesk is now one of the fastest-growing fintechs in Europe, with over 4,000 customers and an international team of 500+ employees based in Paris, Berlin, London, Hamburg, and remote. We’ve raised over €260M from leading investors, and been named a French tech unicorn. And we’re not stopping there!

About our people & culture
We believe that people do their best work when they’re given the freedom to thrive and grow. That’s why liberation is at the core of everything we do. We empower Spendeskers to take ownership of their work, to navigate ambiguity, and seize every opportunity. Spendeskers come from all over the world (35+ countries and counting!) but we have plenty in common: we're bold, ever-curious, committed to kindness, and tackle every challenge with a positive mindset.

About our benefits
Our culture is built on trust, empowerment, and growth — with benefits to match!

Fully covered Oyster card for traveling to and from our new office (up to £250 monthly depending on location)
-£45 monthly wellness allowance, accruable, to be used on whatever wellness means to you - through the Ben platform
Access to Moka.care for emotional and mental health wellbeing
Pension scheme (on salary sacrifice): 5% employee / 5% employer (by Aviva)
28 days of holidays
Latest Apple Mac equipment
Company virtual events
Visit our other offices: Paris, Berlin & Hamburg
Great office snacks to fuel your day
A positive team to work with daily!
Vitality private health insurance (for you and your family/partner)
Bupa private dental care

Diversity & Inclusion
At Spendesk, we're committed to fostering an environment where all differences are encouraged, supported and celebrated. We're building our culture for everyone, with everyone. Our goal is to attract and build a diverse, equal and inclusive team, where everyone feels welcome and we truly embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

What you can expect from the hiring process:

1. A video call with one of our Talent Acquisition Partners to fully understand your career aspirations and answer any questions you have
2. A series of video calls with members of the team to align on what they will expect from you, and assess your technical skills and job fit
3. A final video call with the Hiring Manager, Head-Of or CEO depending on the seniority level to review any remaining questions

Job title: Commercial Valuation Surveyor / Senior Surveyor
Description:
Sector: General Practice Surveyor
Job Type: Permanent
Salary: £45,000 - £55,000 Plus Car Allowance & Benefits
Town/City: London
Region: London
Country: United Kingdom
Reference: AK18968

The Client
Our client is a Leading Property Consultancy with exciting, sustainable growth plans over the next few years looking for amazing people who want to grow along with them. They are a business that values our people that has launched exciting people initiatives to better people's experience, engaging with their people to listen to their needs and wants.
They are proud of their flexible approach to work and offer a hybrid set up where your home location in or around the outer London area should not be a barrier to undertaking this role – they are flexible on where you work, noting that you need to spend time in the London office, and to be able to service clients.
This is a company with a difference, working on a solid foundation of mutual trust, we are commercially focussed, and business orientated. Employing over 230 staff in the UK with a fast-growing presence, serving a wide range of Clients, they have established a strong track record and reputation as the ‘Partner with a purpose’ to help each Client get the most out of their property.
Through a strong network of offices in the UK, they offer a wide range of property services including consultancy, management, investment and commercial agency, residential sales & lettings.
The Role
A great opportunity exists for an experienced Commercial Valuation Surveyor or Senior Surveyor, looking for a position with the potential to progress, based in new West End offices.
The role will predominantly involve providing advice over a wide variety of investment property classes, acting for a range of clients from institutional pension funds, investment fund managers, high net worth individuals and family estates. There will also be the opportunity to undertake loan security valuations, purchase advisory, tax and other ad hoc valuations.
The company has a strong reputation for consultancy and advisory work, and an impressive client list, who have recently provided excellent independent feedback on their service, with metrics well above industry benchmarks. It’s a great place to work, with a strong reputation for quality service and remains an independent partnership.
Key Deliverables
Directly involved with the growth of the commercial valuation business
Ability to lead on the valuation of portfolios reporting directly to clients
High quality presentation skills, with the ability to present information accurately and succinctly both orally and in reports
Ability to reach firm and justifiable conclusions on values for work undertaken by yourself and other members of the team
Ability to work independently with minimal peer review
Ability to deal with several instructions at the same time efficiently and effectively
Deliver fee income commensurate with role.
Requirements
Member of the RICS (MRICS/FRICS)
RICS Registered Valuer
Driving licence
Either just qualified or up to 3 years PQE
Essential Experience
Demonstrable depth of experience in undertaking commercial valuation work across the UK
Proven record in valuation of a wide range of commercial property in several sectors
Experience of direct reporting to clients with good client satisfaction results
Good working knowledge of principal valuation software packages, including Argus Enterprise, Argus Developer and Capitalisation, and KEL Sigma & Developer
Experience of enhancing business performance through use of technology (PropTech), smart working processes, and developing new business initiatives that have led to growth and profitability
Established personal market profile with a range of clients, business, and professional network
Track record of being an active new business generator
Fully conversant with up-to-date RICS Valuation - Professional Standards and financial reporting standards for UK GAAP and IFRS for valuations
Other
Full Driving licence
Sociable
Team player
Benefits
Holidays: 25 – increase in line with length of service to a maximum of 30 days
Enhanced Auto Enrolment Pension Scheme
Life Assurance
Interest Free Season Ticket Loans

Employee Assistance Programme
Plus, Flexible benefits as below
Policy that allows you to pick and choose additional benefits including purchasing 5 days additional holiday

Job title: Senior Operational Software Engineer - Risk Technology
Description:
Operational Software Engineers are responsible for building out, automating, and supporting our critical systems. In this role, you will combine problem solving skills with software and systems engineering to take a proactive approach in building fault-tolerant systems, improving observability/monitoring/alerting capabilities, automating tasks and build tools.
This role, based in London, will be part of the global Risk Technology team, responsible for running the platform that calculates Market Risk, Credit Risk and Margin Calcs for the entire bank. You will have the opportunity to impact the Commodities and Global Markets division within Macquarie front to back, building relationships with a motivated and agile global technology community. You will deliver high quality, low touch, scalable solutions across a mix of technologies and deployment stacks, including cloud and Kubernetes.
You will be offered the opportunity to learn from peers, be encouraged to collaborate and to be bold. You will be an active member of the team, contributing to ideas and peer reviews, mentoring others and being accountable for your solutions end to end.
About You:
A passion for technology, automation and continuous innovation.
Strong analytical, problem solving and debugging skills.
A learning mindset, and the curiosity to dive under the covers.
Effective interpersonal skills and the ability to mentor, coach, team building.
Strong influencing and negotiation skills.
Be proactive in identifying gaps, prioritizing and making suggestions.
Your Experience:
3+ years of experience in Unix/Linux and Bash
3+ Software development experience using Python, Java, C++ or similar
Experience with Git, CI/CD tooling (eg Jenkins)
Hands on experience with Cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, GCP, etc.)
Knowledge of good software design and application architectural practices.
Ability to define and measure non-functional requirements, such as reliability, availability, security, and performance.
Other Valuable Experience:
Docker, Kubernetes, Helm
Financial Services / capital markets experience or interest
Observability and monitoring/alerting – Prometheus, Splunk, Jaeger
Build Tooling – Bazel, Gradle, etc

About Commodities and Global Markets
Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. We are specialized in derivative products, covering multiple asset classes (equities, commodities, interest rates). Our business users are located in London, Amsterdam, Brussels, New York and Singapore. You will be part of a Sophis Dev-Ops Squad located in Brussels and will be responsible to deliver new code related to the Financial Markets Transformation (Digitalisation), working closely with the Commodity desk in London
Your key responsibilities:
As a Dev Engineer,
You propose solutions to business requirements,estimate workload and develop said solutions.
You find the right level of documentation to make sure that sufficient knowledge is available and shared within the team .
You recognize and highlight risk issues on the platform and offer guidance to stay in control by driving structural improvements.
You stay tuned to new trends and technologies to bring innovative solutions to the platform.
You control both the design phase and the actual development and testing of our applications. You understand the entire stack, so that you can bring applications into production and assist in resolving incidents in cooperation with the Ops Engineers.
You are in constant dialogue with your tribe: you understand the goal of our business and work in a team of experts to find the most relevant solution for the customer's needs
As a team member of a DevOps Squad,
You bring the right mind set and work as a team in a pragmatic approach
You take full ownership in building and running the platform
You actively participate in the planning and estimation of tasks
Working for a well established client.

12 months extendable contract

Job title: Cloud Platform Engineer - Software Engineer [Analyst]
Description:
CLOUD PLATFORM ENGINEER – SOFTWARE ENGINEER
SALARY [£58,000 - £65,000]
HYBRID WORKING [LONDON] 2-3 DAYS A WEEK
**SPONSORSHIP AVAILABLE**
My client is a market leading bank, well established for many years who uses state of the art technology.
You’ll be working as part of the Market Valuation and Risk Management (MVRM) Technology area inside Risk, Finance, and Treasury. MVRM systems enable the bank’s risk functions and trading businesses to calculate, generate, analyse, and report on the bank’s significant risk and capital metrics to our regulators.
The clients strategic platform - RiskFinder - is a complete solution for Risk and Capital Metric Management, consisting of a scalable full-revaluation calculation engine with 50k cores, a multi-petabyte-scale Big Data analytics platform, and low-latency in-memory distributed grid reporting technologies. The platform is used by multiple domains/clients, and demand is forecasted to grow significantly in the next five years.
The clients technology stack includes Java, C, C++, PostGres, OracleDB, Lua, Python, Scala, and Spark, plus other off-the-shelf products integrated into one platform.
Your key responsibilities
Collaborating with Product Managers, user experience designers and functional analysts to understand the new system, user-facing desktop, and mobile features
Building the required features as a member of an agile feature team
Cooperating with our quality assurance team to ensure the quality of all changes to the platform
Participating in iteration planning and sprint review ceremonies and engaging with your feature team in the SAFe Program Increment process
Helping maintain code quality via code reviews
Your skills and experience
Educated to bachelor’s degree level (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics preferred) or equivalent qualification/work experience
Experience of a systems language (C, C++, Java, C# etc.)
Knowledge of SQL and Python and in-depth knowledge of Operating Systems, shell languages, git, Software Development Lifecycle tooling
Strong hands-on delivery track record, good exposure to computational concepts and excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal
Cloud (mainly Google) experience is advantageous
McGregor Boyall is an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on any grounds.

Job title: Industry Architect, Financial Services and Insurance, Google Cloud
Description:
Minimum qualifications:
Experience leading cloud transformations in enterprise financial services organizations.
Experience in creating an end-to-end design across various functional domains.
Experience in managing C-level relationships and stakeholder landscape.
Experience in influencing and driving design choices.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience in creating technology strategy, capability roadmaps, and implementation approaches for large migration programs.
Experience in creating end-to-end solution architecture for various financial services workloads and considering the operational needs of a large organization.
Experience in engaging product organization and influencing others to work on product features to drive the overall product strategy and roadmap.
Experience working with cross-functional teams.
About the job
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Drive cloud design and technical delivery across infrastructure, networking, operations, and application migrations by providing technical direction and design leadership.
Engage with the C-level leaders and act as a technical advisor to build confidence and organize overall IT strategy aligned to the broader business needs.
Drive tactical and strategic decision-making for a technology transformation journey. Provide credible advice by leveraging cross-functional technical and functional domains.
Drive industry centric accelerators, assets, and point-of-view to create broader impact across the industry in a specific domain or a technology area.
Ensure predictable technical outcomes for workload migrations to Google Cloud Platform considering the technical and delivery constraints.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.
To apply to this job, click Apply Now

Job title: Senior Cloud Architect – (GCP & Financial Services)
Description:
Since 1993, EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM) has leveraged its advanced software engineering heritage to become the foremost global digital transformation services provider – leading the industry in digital and physical product development and digital platform engineering services. Through its innovative strategy; integrated advisory, consulting, and design capabilities; and unique 'Engineering DNA,' EPAM's globally deployed hybrid teams help make the future real for clients and communities around the world by powering better enterprise, education and health platforms that connect people, optimize experiences, and improve people's lives. In 2021, EPAM was added to the S&P 500 and included among the list of Forbes Global 2000 companies.
Selected by Newsweek as a 2021 and 2022 Most Loved Workplace, EPAM's global multi-disciplinary teams serve customers in more than 50 countries across six continents. As a recognized leader, EPAM is listed among the top 15 companies in Information Technology Services on the Fortune 1000 and ranked four times as the top IT services company on Fortune's 100 Fastest Growing Companies list. EPAM is also listed among Ad Age's top 25 World's Largest Agency Companies for three consecutive years, and Consulting Magazine named EPAM Continuum a top 20 Fastest Growing Firm.
Learn more at www.epam.com and follow EPAM on Twitter and LinkedIn.
DESCRIPTION



Are you an industry visionary and technologist at heart with a passion for designing complex hybrid cloud solutions? Are you a leader with multi cloud knowledge and strong technical background in Architecture design and GCP? Do you have great soft skills, strong stakeholder management and are you able to guide and advise the business and IT teams on the technical and organisational challenges of enterprise cloud transformation?

Then you have an opportunity to joins us as a Senior Cloud Architect, be part of a global EPAM GCP Cloud team and work with one of our biggest EPAM customers.

Bringing your expertise in containerization, architecture design and management skills, you will be leading the Hybrid Cloud Platform team, to build and implement containers strategies using Anthos for Public Clouds and on-prem environments. You will be working closely with experts from connected practices to ensure that your architecture design incorporates smoothly into the bigger, holistically designed solution whilst becoming a Subject Matter Expert in this field and playing an important role in the relationship with our customer.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with business in identifying solution requirements and key case-studies/scenarios for the future solution
Enable multi cloud journey, analyse TCO and create a business case, make the Cloud dream become reality
Design and prototype cloud infrastructure, create infrastructure and security architecture document covering deep technical aspects of the implementation
Create a unified strategy for cloud transformation governance, automation, security, implementation, and operations
Analyse existing application and IT services portfolios, develop assets’ migration, transformation and automation roadmap
Lead implementation of the solution from establishing project requirements and goals to solution "go-live"
Oversee the cloud system engineering efforts and provide technical help as needed
Design and develop next-generation hybrid-cloud and multi cloud solutions, supervising their implementation, ensuring that the industry best practices are followed
Work in a tight cooperation with GCP architecture and delivery team to ensure a successful implementation and transparent delivery of the projects
Robust and consistent Cloud Strategy design aligned with business objectives
Provide guidelines for infrastructure migration approaches and techniques including numerous applications migrations into the cloud and implementation of hybrid cloud solutions within regulated enterprise environments
Day-to-day lead the client through the technical and organizational challenges of Cloud transformation
Maintain a strong understanding of industry trends and best practices and create thought leadership on GCP solutions

REQUIREMENTS
Hands-on multi cloud or GCP delivery experience in a Lead/Senior Architect position
Google Cloud Platform Expertise in Financial Services Industry
Technical expertise with Anthos Service Mesh
Avid technologist, with strong technical background and deep expertise in modern cloud architecture
A strong history of successful implementation of complex multi cloud or GCP solutions
Experience architecting, designing, migrating workloads to the public cloud
Multi-tier distributed architecture experience within IT consulting, IT operations, application development or support which includes migrating, architecting, operating on premises and cloud-based solutions, or experience transforming legacy IT solutions, and working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
A strong management and leadership skillset, experienced managing medium to large sized teams including budgeting, staffing, escalations, development
Experience developing proper product approach for platforms and implement container strategies using Anthos (or other container platforms) for public cloud and on prem environments
Ability to suggest competitive and innovative technical decisions, get client buy-in and deliver on commitments
In-depth understanding and hands on experience with DevOps techniques and processes related to cloud solutions
Extensive experience and understanding of Cloud FinOps
Broad knowledge of troubleshooting approaches and driving-to-resolution technical integration issues across various platforms
Experience in architecting and running consumer-facing applications in a hybrid, multi-cloud environment
Strong written, verbal communication skills with ability to present technical ideas in business-friendly language
Analytical and problem-solving abilities

WE OFFER
We offer a range of benefits including
A competitive group pension plan, life assurance and income protection
Private medical insurance, private dental care and critical illness cover
Cycle scheme Tech scheme and season ticket loan
Employee assistance program
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) (subject to certain eligibility requirements)
Various perks such as Gym discount, Friday lunch, on-site massage and regular social events
Some of these benefits may be available only after you have passed your probationary period

Job title: Senior Software Engineer - Banking
Description:
The banking team within Spendesk oversees everything thing related to money. From generating virtual cards, to making a wire transfer, or maintaining balance for customer accounts. This critical part of the software requires secure and reliable solutions. Your work is to develop and maintain the API that offers banking services within Spendesk, and the back office that allows internal auditors to operate the banking platform.
We expect engineers to be able to work on every part of the feature, specs, technical design, development, testing, documentation, and maintenance. Money doesn't allow approximation; in the banking squad, we don't compromise over quality.
Finally, your job is not only about writing code, we are looking for great team players. As money is at the heart of our system, you’ll get to work closely with anyone across the company and every decision you’ll make may have a huge impact.
Our stack:
Typescript
Node.js for our backend and banking applications
React/Redux on the frontend of the Backoffice.
PostgreSQL for data storage, Redis and SQS for jobs and queues
Terraform to define our infrastructure
AWS to run all of this
Github actions for CI.
What we're looking for:
Numerous years’ experience in back-end development with respect to state-of-the-art practices
Strong experience in designing distributed and secure systems
Modern JavaScript/ES6 libraries
Experience with NodeJS on large scale backend applications
Good knowledge of micro-services architectures
Experience designing, building and maintaining APIs
A product focussed mindset
Comfortable with DevOps aspects
Autonomy, fast-learning and proactiveness
Good knowledge on testing best practices
As we are an international team, please submit your application and CV in English.


About Spendesk
Spendesk is the 7-in-1 spending solution built for finance teams to make faster, smarter spending decisions. Founded in 2016, Spendesk is now one of the fastest-growing fintechs in Europe, with over 4,000 customers and an international team of 500+ employees based in Paris, Berlin, London, Hamburg, and remote. We’ve raised over €260M from leading investors, and been named a French tech unicorn. And we’re not stopping there!

About our people & culture
We believe that people do their best work when they’re given the freedom to thrive and grow. That’s why liberation is at the core of everything we do. We empower Spendeskers to take ownership of their work, to navigate ambiguity, and seize every opportunity. Spendeskers come from all over the world (35+ countries and counting!) but we have plenty in common: we're bold, ever-curious, committed to kindness, and tackle every challenge with a positive mindset.

About our benefits
Our culture is built on trust, empowerment, and growth — with benefits to match!

Fully covered Oyster card for traveling to and from our new office (up to £250 monthly depending on location)
-£45 monthly wellness allowance, accruable, to be used on whatever wellness means to you - through the Ben platform
Access to Moka.care for emotional and mental health wellbeing
Pension scheme (on salary sacrifice): 5% employee / 5% employer (by Aviva)
28 days of holidays
Latest Apple Mac equipment
Company virtual events
Visit our other offices: Paris, Berlin & Hamburg
Great office snacks to fuel your day
A positive team to work with daily!
Vitality private health insurance (for you and your family/partner)
Bupa private dental care

Diversity & Inclusion
At Spendesk, we're committed to fostering an environment where all differences are encouraged, supported and celebrated. We're building our culture for everyone, with everyone. Our goal is to attract and build a diverse, equal and inclusive team, where everyone feels welcome and we truly embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

What you can expect from the hiring process:

1. A video call with one of our Talent Acquisition Partners to fully understand your career aspirations and answer any questions you have
2. A series of video calls with members of the team to align on what they will expect from you, and assess your technical skills and job fit
3. A final video call with the Hiring Manager, Head-Of or CEO depending on the seniority level to review any remaining questions

Job title: Commercial Valuation Surveyor / Senior Surveyor
Description:
Sector: General Practice Surveyor
Job Type: Permanent
Salary: £45,000 - £55,000 Plus Car Allowance & Benefits
Town/City: London
Region: London
Country: United Kingdom
Reference: AK18968

The Client
Our client is a Leading Property Consultancy with exciting, sustainable growth plans over the next few years looking for amazing people who want to grow along with them. They are a business that values our people that has launched exciting people initiatives to better people's experience, engaging with their people to listen to their needs and wants.
They are proud of their flexible approach to work and offer a hybrid set up where your home location in or around the outer London area should not be a barrier to undertaking this role – they are flexible on where you work, noting that you need to spend time in the London office, and to be able to service clients.
This is a company with a difference, working on a solid foundation of mutual trust, we are commercially focussed, and business orientated. Employing over 230 staff in the UK with a fast-growing presence, serving a wide range of Clients, they have established a strong track record and reputation as the ‘Partner with a purpose’ to help each Client get the most out of their property.
Through a strong network of offices in the UK, they offer a wide range of property services including consultancy, management, investment and commercial agency, residential sales & lettings.
The Role
A great opportunity exists for an experienced Commercial Valuation Surveyor or Senior Surveyor, looking for a position with the potential to progress, based in new West End offices.
The role will predominantly involve providing advice over a wide variety of investment property classes, acting for a range of clients from institutional pension funds, investment fund managers, high net worth individuals and family estates. There will also be the opportunity to undertake loan security valuations, purchase advisory, tax and other ad hoc valuations.
The company has a strong reputation for consultancy and advisory work, and an impressive client list, who have recently provided excellent independent feedback on their service, with metrics well above industry benchmarks. It’s a great place to work, with a strong reputation for quality service and remains an independent partnership.
Key Deliverables
Directly involved with the growth of the commercial valuation business
Ability to lead on the valuation of portfolios reporting directly to clients
High quality presentation skills, with the ability to present information accurately and succinctly both orally and in reports
Ability to reach firm and justifiable conclusions on values for work undertaken by yourself and other members of the team
Ability to work independently with minimal peer review
Ability to deal with several instructions at the same time efficiently and effectively
Deliver fee income commensurate with role.
Requirements
Member of the RICS (MRICS/FRICS)
RICS Registered Valuer
Driving licence
Either just qualified or up to 3 years PQE
Essential Experience
Demonstrable depth of experience in undertaking commercial valuation work across the UK
Proven record in valuation of a wide range of commercial property in several sectors
Experience of direct reporting to clients with good client satisfaction results
Good working knowledge of principal valuation software packages, including Argus Enterprise, Argus Developer and Capitalisation, and KEL Sigma & Developer
Experience of enhancing business performance through use of technology (PropTech), smart working processes, and developing new business initiatives that have led to growth and profitability
Established personal market profile with a range of clients, business, and professional network
Track record of being an active new business generator
Fully conversant with up-to-date RICS Valuation - Professional Standards and financial reporting standards for UK GAAP and IFRS for valuations
Other
Full Driving licence
Sociable
Team player
Benefits
Holidays: 25 – increase in line with length of service to a maximum of 30 days
Enhanced Auto Enrolment Pension Scheme
Life Assurance
Interest Free Season Ticket Loans
Cycle to work scheme
Flu and Eye Care Vouchers
Employee Assistance Programme
Plus, Flexible benefits as below
Policy that allows you to pick and choose additional benefits including purchasing 5 days additional holiday
Discounted Gym membership
Dental Insurance
Travel Insurance
My client offers real scope for career development for a dedicated, professional and enthusiastic individual with a strong work ethic who wants to join one of the market leaders.
If you wish to apply for this position, please email your CV to andrew@kingsleyrecruitment.co.uk or call Andrew Kingsley on 07879 413 765 for further information.

Job title: Senior Operational Software Engineer - Risk Technology
Description:
Operational Software Engineers are responsible for building out, automating, and supporting our critical systems. In this role, you will combine problem solving skills with software and systems engineering to take a proactive approach in building fault-tolerant systems, improving observability/monitoring/alerting capabilities, automating tasks and build tools.
This role, based in London, will be part of the global Risk Technology team, responsible for running the platform that calculates Market Risk, Credit Risk and Margin Calcs for the entire bank. You will have the opportunity to impact the Commodities and Global Markets division within Macquarie front to back, building relationships with a motivated and agile global technology community. You will deliver high quality, low touch, scalable solutions across a mix of technologies and deployment stacks, including cloud and Kubernetes.
You will be offered the opportunity to learn from peers, be encouraged to collaborate and to be bold. You will be an active member of the team, contributing to ideas and peer reviews, mentoring others and being accountable for your solutions end to end.
About You:
A passion for technology, automation and continuous innovation.
Strong analytical, problem solving and debugging skills.
A learning mindset, and the curiosity to dive under the covers.
Effective interpersonal skills and the ability to mentor, coach, team building.
Strong influencing and negotiation skills.
Be proactive in identifying gaps, prioritizing and making suggestions.
Your Experience:
3+ years of experience in Unix/Linux and Bash
3+ Software development experience using Python, Java, C++ or similar
Experience with Git, CI/CD tooling (eg Jenkins)
Hands on experience with Cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, GCP, etc.)
Knowledge of good software design and application architectural practices.
Ability to define and measure non-functional requirements, such as reliability, availability, security, and performance.
Other Valuable Experience:
Docker, Kubernetes, Helm
Financial Services / capital markets experience or interest
Observability and monitoring/alerting – Prometheus, Splunk, Jaeger
Build Tooling – Bazel, Gradle, etc
If this role sounds like the right opportunity to further your career, please apply via the link.
About Commodities and Global Markets
Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable workplace enables us to embrace that diversity to deliver more innovative and sustainable solutions for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. At Macquarie, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If you're inspired to deliver on our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’, we want you on our team. If you need adjustments made to the recruitment process, please reach out to your recruiter.
As an inclusive employer, Macquarie does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (including colour and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief.

Joining Macquarie means you’ll be able to work in a way that suits you best. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways. Talk to us about what working arrangements would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 18,000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Job title: Cloud Platform Engineer - Software Engineer [Analyst]
Description:
CLOUD PLATFORM ENGINEER – SOFTWARE ENGINEER
SALARY [£58,000 - £65,000]
HYBRID WORKING [LONDON] 2-3 DAYS A WEEK
**SPONSORSHIP AVAILABLE**
My client is a market leading bank, well established for many years who uses state of the art technology.
You’ll be working as part of the Market Valuation and Risk Management (MVRM) Technology area inside Risk, Finance, and Treasury. MVRM systems enable the bank’s risk functions and trading businesses to calculate, generate, analyse, and report on the bank’s significant risk and capital metrics to our regulators.
The clients strategic platform - RiskFinder - is a complete solution for Risk and Capital Metric Management, consisting of a scalable full-revaluation calculation engine with 50k cores, a multi-petabyte-scale Big Data analytics platform, and low-latency in-memory distributed grid reporting technologies. The platform is used by multiple domains/clients, and demand is forecasted to grow significantly in the next five years.
The clients technology stack includes Java, C, C++, PostGres, OracleDB, Lua, Python, Scala, and Spark, plus other off-the-shelf products integrated into one platform.
Your key responsibilities
Collaborating with Product Managers, user experience designers and functional analysts to understand the new system, user-facing desktop, and mobile features
Building the required features as a member of an agile feature team
Cooperating with our quality assurance team to ensure the quality of all changes to the platform
Participating in iteration planning and sprint review ceremonies and engaging with your feature team in the SAFe Program Increment process
Helping maintain code quality via code reviews
Your skills and experience
Educated to bachelor’s degree level (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics preferred) or equivalent qualification/work experience
Experience of a systems language (C, C++, Java, C# etc.)
Knowledge of SQL and Python and in-depth knowledge of Operating Systems, shell languages, git, Software Development Lifecycle tooling
Strong hands-on delivery track record, good exposure to computational concepts and excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal
Cloud (mainly Google) experience is advantageous
McGregor Boyall is an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on any grounds.

Job title: Industry Architect, Financial Services and Insurance, Google Cloud
Description:
Minimum qualifications:
Experience leading cloud transformations in enterprise financial services organizations.
Experience in creating an end-to-end design across various functional domains.
Experience in managing C-level relationships and stakeholder landscape.
Experience in influencing and driving design choices.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience in creating technology strategy, capability roadmaps, and implementation approaches for large migration programs.
Experience in creating end-to-end solution architecture for various financial services workloads and considering the operational needs of a large organization.
Experience in engaging product organization and influencing others to work on product features to drive the overall product strategy and roadmap.
Experience working with cross-functional teams.
About the job
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Drive cloud design and technical delivery across infrastructure, networking, operations, and application migrations by providing technical direction and design leadership.
Engage with the C-level leaders and act as a technical advisor to build confidence and organize overall IT strategy aligned to the broader business needs.
Drive tactical and strategic decision-making for a technology transformation journey. Provide credible advice by leveraging cross-functional technical and functional domains.
Drive industry centric accelerators, assets, and point-of-view to create broader impact across the industry in a specific domain or a technology area.
Ensure predictable technical outcomes for workload migrations to Google Cloud Platform considering the technical and delivery constraints.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Job title: Senior Cloud Architect – (GCP & Financial Services)
Description:
Since 1993, EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM) has leveraged its advanced software engineering heritage to become the foremost global digital transformation services provider – leading the industry in digital and physical product development and digital platform engineering services. Through its innovative strategy; integrated advisory, consulting, and design capabilities; and unique 'Engineering DNA,' EPAM's globally deployed hybrid teams help make the future real for clients and communities around the world by powering better enterprise, education and health platforms that connect people, optimize experiences, and improve people's lives. In 2021, EPAM was added to the S&P 500 and included among the list of Forbes Global 2000 companies.
Selected by Newsweek as a 2021 and 2022 Most Loved Workplace, EPAM's global multi-disciplinary teams serve customers in more than 50 countries across six continents. As a recognized leader, EPAM is listed among the top 15 companies in Information Technology Services on the Fortune 1000 and ranked four times as the top IT services company on Fortune's 100 Fastest Growing Companies list. EPAM is also listed among Ad Age's top 25 World's Largest Agency Companies for three consecutive years, and Consulting Magazine named EPAM Continuum a top 20 Fastest Growing Firm.
Learn more at www.epam.com and follow EPAM on Twitter and LinkedIn.
DESCRIPTION



Are you an industry visionary and technologist at heart with a passion for designing complex hybrid cloud solutions? Are you a leader with multi cloud knowledge and strong technical background in Architecture design and GCP? Do you have great soft skills, strong stakeholder management and are you able to guide and advise the business and IT teams on the technical and organisational challenges of enterprise cloud transformation?

Then you have an opportunity to joins us as a Senior Cloud Architect, be part of a global EPAM GCP Cloud team and work with one of our biggest EPAM customers.

Bringing your expertise in containerization, architecture design and management skills, you will be leading the Hybrid Cloud Platform team, to build and implement containers strategies using Anthos for Public Clouds and on-prem environments. You will be working closely with experts from connected practices to ensure that your architecture design incorporates smoothly into the bigger, holistically designed solution whilst becoming a Subject Matter Expert in this field and playing an important role in the relationship with our customer.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with business in identifying solution requirements and key case-studies/scenarios for the future solution
Enable multi cloud journey, analyse TCO and create a business case, make the Cloud dream become reality
Design and prototype cloud infrastructure, create infrastructure and security architecture document covering deep technical aspects of the implementation
Create a unified strategy for cloud transformation governance, automation, security, implementation, and operations
Analyse existing application and IT services portfolios, develop assets’ migration, transformation and automation roadmap
Lead implementation of the solution from establishing project requirements and goals to solution "go-live"
Oversee the cloud system engineering efforts and provide technical help as needed
Design and develop next-generation hybrid-cloud and multi cloud solutions, supervising their implementation, ensuring that the industry best practices are followed
Work in a tight cooperation with GCP architecture and delivery team to ensure a successful implementation and transparent delivery of the projects
Robust and consistent Cloud Strategy design aligned with business objectives
Provide guidelines for infrastructure migration approaches and techniques including numerous applications migrations into the cloud and implementation of hybrid cloud solutions within regulated enterprise environments
Day-to-day lead the client through the technical and organizational challenges of Cloud transformation
Maintain a strong understanding of industry trends and best practices and create thought leadership on GCP solutions

REQUIREMENTS
Hands-on multi cloud or GCP delivery experience in a Lead/Senior Architect position
Google Cloud Platform Expertise in Financial Services Industry
Technical expertise with Anthos Service Mesh
Avid technologist, with strong technical background and deep expertise in modern cloud architecture
A strong history of successful implementation of complex multi cloud or GCP solutions
Experience architecting, designing, migrating workloads to the public cloud
Multi-tier distributed architecture experience within IT consulting, IT operations, application development or support which includes migrating, architecting, operating on premises and cloud-based solutions, or experience transforming legacy IT solutions, and working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
A strong management and leadership skillset, experienced managing medium to large sized teams including budgeting, staffing, escalations, development
Experience developing proper product approach for platforms and implement container strategies using Anthos (or other container platforms) for public cloud and on prem environments
Ability to suggest competitive and innovative technical decisions, get client buy-in and deliver on commitments
In-depth understanding and hands on experience with DevOps techniques and processes related to cloud solutions
Extensive experience and understanding of Cloud FinOps
Broad knowledge of troubleshooting approaches and driving-to-resolution technical integration issues across various platforms
Experience in architecting and running consumer-facing applications in a hybrid, multi-cloud environment
Strong written, verbal communication skills with ability to present technical ideas in business-friendly language
Analytical and problem-solving abilities

WE OFFER
We offer a range of benefits including
A competitive group pension plan, life assurance and income protection
Private medical insurance, private dental care and critical illness cover
Cycle scheme Tech scheme and season ticket loan
Employee assistance program
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) (subject to certain eligibility requirements)
Various perks such as Gym discount, Friday lunch, on-site massage and regular social events
Some of these benefits may be available only after you have passed your probationary period
